scenario_name: DataPulse AI Insights Feature Launch – Acme Analytics
company_context: Acme Analytics is a SaaS company in the Business Intelligence space serving mid‑market SaaS and e‑commerce firms. The product, Acme Dashboard, provides real‑time visualizations and reporting. The new feature, **DataPulse AI Insights**, adds AI‑driven predictive forecasts, anomaly detection, and automated insight cards directly into existing dashboards. Target customers are data analysts, product managers, and growth teams who need faster, more accurate forward‑looking metrics. Value proposition: cut time‑to‑insight by 50% and improve forecast accuracy by 20% versus manual methods. The launch is high‑complexity (AI model validation, data pipeline scaling, compliance) and follows a T‑30 workback schedule.
meeting_event_details: Kickoff Launch Planning Meeting – 2025-11-15, 09:00 AM PST (UTC‑8), 2‑hour duration, Acme Headquarters Conference Room A (Hybrid: in‑person + Zoom link: https://zoom.acme.com/launch‑kickoff). Agenda: review feature scope, assign responsibilities, confirm timeline, identify dependencies and risks.
stakeholders: Maya Patel – Senior Director of Product Management (Feature Owner, defines scope, approves go‑to‑market strategy)
Carlos Ruiz – Principal Engineer, AI Platform (Engineering Lead, responsible for model deployment, performance testing, and data pipeline readiness)
Priya Singh – Head of Marketing (Marketing Lead, creates positioning, messaging, demand generation plan, and launch communications)
Jordan Lee – VP of Sales (Sales Lead, builds sales enablement, pricing, and quota planning)
Elena Gomez – Director of Customer Success (Support Lead, designs support playbook, training, and post‑launch monitoring)
Tom Whitaker – Program Manager, Launch Office (Launch Coordinator, tracks milestones, facilitates cross‑functional sync, manages budget)
deliverables: AI Model Validation Report (accuracy, bias, GDPR compliance) – 2025-12-01
Release Notes & Product Update Blog Draft – 2025-12-08
Customer‑Facing User Guide (PDF) and Quick‑Start Video – 2025-12-10
In‑App Announcement Banner copy & design assets – 2025-12-12
Webinar Script & Slides for “Live Demo of DataPulse AI Insights” – 2025-12-14
success_criteria: At least 20% of existing customers enable DataPulse AI Insights within 30 days of launch
Net Promoter Score (NPS) for the new feature ≥ 45 in the first survey window
Generate $500,000 incremental ARR from upsells and new logos in Q1 2026
Reduce churn among target segment by 5% YoY attributable to the new feature
Support tickets related to DataPulse AI Insights ≤ 5% of total support volume in the first month
Achieve ≥ 30% email open rate and ≥ 8% click‑through rate on launch announcement
constraints: Total launch marketing budget capped at $150,000
AI model must receive GDPR‑compliant data processing certification by 2025-12-01
Engineering bandwidth limited to 2 full‑time engineers for final QA and hot‑fixes after 2025-12-05
All customer‑facing documentation must be approved by Legal and Compliance by 2025-12-08
Launch must not conflict with the scheduled release of Acme Dashboard v3.2 on 2025-12-20
workback_prompt: Create a detailed workback plan for the **DataPulse AI Insights** feature launch at Acme Analytics. The launch is scheduled for **2025-12-15 10:00 AM PST** and follows a T‑30 planning horizon. Include all phases (strategy, development, QA, documentation, marketing, sales enablement, support readiness, launch day execution, post‑launch monitoring). Break down tasks by week, assign owners (using the stakeholder list provided), indicate dependencies, critical path items, risk mitigation steps, and required approvals. Provide a Gantt‑style timeline, a RACI matrix, and a checklist of go/no‑go criteria for the launch day. Use the scenario details above (company context, deliverables, success criteria, constraints) to ensure the plan is realistic and actionable.
